intro: Quercus kanehirae, commonly known as the Kanehirae oak, is a rare and endemic species native to Japan. It belongs to the Fagaceae family, which includes oaks, beeches, and chestnuts. This small to medium-sized tree typically grows in mountainous regions, preferring well-drained soils and cool, humid climates. Its leaves are lobed and often have a glossy upper surface, while its acorns are small and usually enclosed in a cupule. The plant plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, supporting local wildlife and contributing to forest biodiversity.
